Conversation.line: Buckle down, everyone. Next stop: the cold and dark depths of Europe.
Don't you mean Europa?
Same difference.
Born of the dust...
Forged by the magma...
Tempered by the frost.
Godspeed, team. It's time to set sail.
And broken by the monsters.
Offering to be next on the menu?
What's the deal with shuttle food?
Heard it has something to do with pressurization.
I'm starving...
I wonder what crawler eggs taste like.
I wonder what mudraptor eggs taste like.
I wonder what hammerhead ribs taste like.
I wonder what thresher liver tastes like.
I wonder what spineling marrow tastes like.
I wonder what mantis tail tastes like.
I wonder what thalamus flesh tastes like.
I wonder what moloch marrow tastes like.
Do you think mermaids exist?
The depths would never bless us with such a beautiful thing.
You're depressing.
Would be a nice change of pace. Something that doesn't want to kill us, for once.
Could sure use some eye candy between the hailstorms of monster gore.
I hear that sub racing is back in fashion.
Wasn't it just the one event?
One event, but the numbers didn't lie. Scratched an itch that the public hasn't had scratched in a while.
Was all fun and games until the Latcher showed up. If you want to risk that for a hobby, be my guest.
Overrated, if you ask me.
Maybe we oughta join sometime. Win a few marks, get a break from the gloom.
I think it has potential.
Just don't ask me to pilot... This girl's been banged around enough already.
That's what she said!
You ever heard of percussive maintenance?
Tried it on a junction box, once. Woke up on the floor with a bad concussion.
Skill issue.
Doesn't make the boat go any faster, unfortunately.
Sure wish I could whack you lot into shape sometimes.
Ain't that what CPR is?
We have a word for that: violence.
Hear me out...
In terms of compatibility, humans and Mudr-
You can't just turn off my radio! Dick.
No. Absolutely not.
Oh, you're just begging for the airlock now.
You're not covering my ship in monster jizz.
Not this again, please.
You can't silence the truth forever!
The thing's beak begs to differ.
I can. Now shut it.
No, you can't fuck the fish. Shut up.
"We all live in a yellow submarine..."
"Yellow submarine, yellow submarine."
We didn't get a new paintjob, did we?
Doesn't look terribly yellow to me.
Favorite sub, anyone?
Alright, hot take... the Barsuk.
Didn't take you as one to pilot a pile of scrap.
Name another sub that just comes with a pulse laser.
Good luck actually getting it anywhere, though.
Beginner choice, but the Dugong holds its own.
Doesn't that one not even have a forward gun?
Well... yeah. It's a budget ship. But that simplicity is its strength, if you ask me.
Just don't come running when the hull pops like a balloon.
Silky smooth and to the point? That'll be the Orca.
It's a great one... when it actually works.
Why does the thing need so much damn power?
It doesn't need a lot to get the job done. Any mishaps are on the captain, not the sub.
Ol' reliable. Referring to the Camel, of course.
Famously unable to defend its center line, I remember now.
At least the chaingun puts in all the work you need. Great power management, too.
Maneuverability could use some work, though.
Is that even a question? The Humpback, for sure.
I'm surprised those are even in production. How does anyone stand them?
They're reliable is why. Temperamental, sure, but that beefy bottom turret makes for good 'kick em while they're down' material.
I've run into a few enemy Humpbacks before. You don't mess with those things, man.
Only thing better than one Orca... is two Orcas. Or the Orca 2.
I don't know what to tell you. It's simply better.
It trades its downsides for simply being unimpressive in comparison. Why not get any other sub?
Because it's really good at getting where it needs to go.
I travel in style. Azimuth life for me.
Great agility, great flood handling, great looks... what's not to like?
Its lack of overhead coverage, for one.
What do you do when a thresher's chowing down on your ceiling?
The harbinger of destruction - the one and only Typhon.
Might take it a few years to bring that destruction, though.
Doesn't matter. No matter where you go, you can never truly escape it.
Cornering something with overwhelming firepower never gets old.
It's a weird one, but the Herja's actually kinda nice.
That type of gun coverage with only three guns is to die for.
Good luck dealing with boarding parties, though. That oughta suck.
That top railgun begs to differ.
Big operations require Big Rigs.
And even bigger blind spots. What sub doesn't come with a bottom gun?
One that has two discharge coils and a healthy battery capacity.
Slap a gun down there, and she's a mighty beast.
Sit down and make way for the queen of all subs; you know the one.
The Berilia might be hungry, but she's a powerhouse that demands respect.
Hard to respect a gigantic target with insane crew requirements.
Come back to me when you've successfully fought one of those things. Even while she's down, she just keeps kicking.
Remora, final answer. Agile and flexible are just my style.
Don't you find the interior super awkward? Everything's all over the place.
It's manageable, that's all I can really say. Plus, that drone is nothing to scoff at.
Helps with covering the undefended underside until you can get some extra firepower. Then you have yourself a free mobile gun.
You know, the Typhon was so good that they actually made a second one.
Most guns out of any sub, and electric defenses just for good measure.
Still not much better in the speed department, though. Can't really shoot things if you can't catch em.
Just make sure they can't run away in the first place.
Say what you want, the Kastrull does work.
Unless you poke a hole in it, that is.
I'd like to see anything try. This thing has so many weapons it's not even funny.
Oh, and its drone with a frontal gun, too. A little extra overkill, as a treat.
I feel like it goes without saying; the Winterhalter is in a class of its own.
You'd be correct if you meant that in terms of energy demands.
It tries to be everything, and fails to be practical.
What's that thing people say? Master of none, but sometimes better than a master of one?
I'd rather take stormy seas than... whatever the fuck this is.
But our hand is dealt. Play it!
Shit sucks! Can you focus now?
There's some saying about the Abyss's gaze, isn't there?
Whatever it is, I'm starting to feel like it really is watching us...
Gaze into the Abyss, and it'll gaze back into you. That's what they say, at least.
I'm certainly not inclined to disagree right now.
I can't help but wonder if we've gazed too deep.
Its gaze is cold. So... so cold.
...We're fucked, aren't we?
Not if I shoot its beady eye out first.
Oh shit.
Oh, god.
Oh jeez, oh fuck!
Really wish we'd picked up that upgrade back there!
I don't suppose we have a mini nuke in the cabinet?
You'll never take me alive!
Might take you dead, though!
